definition: To make a sudden, involuntary movement or twitch, often in response to a stimulus or as a reflex action. It is commonly used to describe a quick, jerky motion of a body part, typically an arm, leg, or facial muscle.

examples.german: Der Hund zuckte mit dem Schwanz.
Plötzlich zuckte ein Blitz über den Himmel.
examples.english: Suddenly a lightning bolt flashed across the sky.

examples.german: Er zuckte zusammen, als er die Spinne sah.
examples.english: He recoiled when he saw the spider.
